tit.cmt: 頭文字を大文字に変更

sen.j: 彦太忍信命（ひこふつおしのまことのみこと、生没年不詳）は、『古事記』『日本書紀』に記される皇族（王族）。
sen.e: Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto (彦太忍信命: year of birth and death unknown) was a member of Imperial family (Royal family), who appears in "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 名前の表記についての記述が後列にあるため、漢字を加えました。
sen.e: Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto (彦太忍信命: year of birth and death unknown) was a member of Imperial family (Royal family), who appears in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto (彦太忍信命: year of birth and death unknown) was a member of Imperial family (Royal family), who appears in the "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
His name is also written as 比古布都押之信命(Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto) (according to "Kojiki")..
sen.cmt: 名前の漢字表記を加えました。 『記』→"Kojiki"としました。
sen.e: His name is also written as 比古布都押之信命(Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto) (according to the "Kojiki").
sen.cmt: 余分なピリオド削除、the追加
sen.e: His name is also written as 比古布都押之信命(Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto) (according to the "Kojiki").

sen.j: 8代孝元天皇の皇子で、母は鬱色雄命（うつしこおのみこと）の娘・伊香色謎命（いかがしこめのみこと・伊賀迦色許売命）。
sen.e: He was the Imperial Prince of the eighth Emperor Kogen, and his mother was Ikagashikome no mikoto, the daughter of Utsushikoo no mikoto.
He was the prince of the eighth Emperor Kogen, and his mother was Ikagashikome no mikoto, the daughter of Utsushikoo no mikoto.
He was the prince of the eighth Emperor Kogen, and his mother was Ikagashikome no mikoto, the daughter of Utsushikoo no mikoto.

sen.j: また、武内宿禰の父（『記』）、あるいは祖父（『書紀』）に当たる。
sen.e: He was the father (according to "Kojiki") or the grandfather (according to "Nihonshoki") of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune (according to "Kojiki").
He was the father (according to the "Kojiki") or the grandfather (according to the "Nihonshoki") of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.
He was the father (according to the "Kojiki") or the grandfather (according to the "Nihonshoki") of TAKENOUCHI no Sukune.

sen.j: 葛城氏を始め、蘇我氏・紀氏・巨勢氏・平群氏などの祖。
sen.e: He was the ancestor of the Katsuragi clan, as well as, the Soga clan, Ki clan, Kose clan, Heguri clan, and others.
He was the ancestor of the Katsuragi clan, as well as, the Soga clan, Ki clan, Kose clan, Heguri clan, and others.
He was the ancestor of the Katsuragi clan, as well as, the Soga clan, Ki clan, Kose clan, Heguri clan, and others.

sen.j: 『古事記』では、紀伊国造宇豆比古（うずひこ・うじひこ/菟道彦）の妹・山下影日売を娶り、建内宿禰（武内宿禰）を生むとあるが、『書紀』では、孫の武内宿禰の父を屋主忍男武雄心命（やぬしおしおたけおごころのみこと）としており、彼は彦太忍信命の子となる。
sen.e: According to "Kojiki," he took the younger sister of Kiinokuni no Miyatsukuko Uzuhiko (Ujihiko), Princess Yamashitakagehime to wife, and had a son, TAKEUCHI no Sukune (written as 建内宿禰 or 武内宿禰), however, according to "Nihonshoki," the father of his grandson TAKENOUCHI no Sukune was Yanushioshiotakeogokoro no mikoto, who, therefore, would be the son of Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 建内宿禰（武内宿禰）→TAKEUCHI no sukune (writteh as 建内宿禰 or 武内宿禰） と名前表記の漢字を加えました。
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," he took the younger sister of Kiinokuni no Miyatsukuko Uzuhiko (Ujihiko), Princess Yamashitakagehime to wife, and had a son, TAKENOUCHI no Sukune (written as 建内宿禰 or 武内宿禰), however, according to the "Nihonshoki," the father of his grandson TAKENOUCHI no Sukune was Yanushioshiotakeogokoro no mikoto, who, therefore, would be the son of Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto.
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、TAKEUCHI→TAKENOUCHIに修正、the追加
sen.e: According to the "Kojiki," he took the younger sister of Kiinokuni no Miyatsukuko Uzuhiko (Ujihiko), Princess Yamashitakagehime to wife, and had a son, TAKENOUCHI no Sukune (written as 建内宿禰 or 武内宿禰), however, according to the "Nihonshoki," the father of his grandson TAKENOUCHI no Sukune was Yanushioshiotakeogokoro no mikoto, who, therefore, would be the son of Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto.

sen.j: 命は玉垂神社（福岡県筑後市）・伊萬里神社（佐賀県伊万里市）・梅田神社（京都府福知山市三和町 (京都府)）・大湊神社（福井県坂井市）・新田神社 (薩摩川内市)摂社武内社（鹿児島県薩摩川内市）で祀られている。
sen.e: 命He (Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto) was enshrined in Tamatare-jinja Shrine (Chikugo City, Fukuoka Prefecture), Imari-jinja Shrine (Imari City, Saga Prefecture), Umeda-jinja Shrine (Miwa Cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture), Ominato-jinja Shrine (Sakai City, Fukui Prefecture), and Nitta-jinja Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture), sessha (auxiliary shrine) Takeuchi-sha Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 命→He (Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto)としました。 摂社武内社（鹿児島県薩摩川内市）→ sessha (auxillary shrine) Takeuchi-sha Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture)としました。
sen.e: He (Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto) was enshrined in Tamatare-jinja Shrine (Chikugo City, Fukuoka Prefecture), Imari-jinja Shrine (Imari City, Saga Prefecture), Umeda-jinja Shrine (Miwa-cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture), Ominato-jinja Shrine (Sakai City, Fukui Prefecture), and Nitta-jinja Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture), sessha (auxiliary shrine) Takeuchi-sha Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
sen.cmt: 命He→Heに修正、Miwa Cho→Miwa-choとしました。
sen.e: He (Hikofutsuoshinomakoto no mikoto) was enshrined in Tamatare-jinja Shrine (Chikugo City, Fukuoka Prefecture), Imari-jinja Shrine (Imari City, Saga Prefecture), Umeda-jinja Shrine (Miwa-cho, Fukuchiyama City, Kyoto Prefecture), Ominato-jinja Shrine (Sakai City, Fukui Prefecture), and Nitta-jinja Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture), sessha (auxiliary shrine) Takeuchi-sha Shrine (Satsumasendai City, Kagoshima Prefecture).
